articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Songdowon International Children's Camp
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Songdowon International Children's Camp
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					He looked round the statue of President Kim Il Sung standing in the compound of the camp.
					
					He called the camp a historic place. Recollecting that Kim Il Sung personally chose the site of the camp in 1959, the postwar period, and made sure that it was built, he added that in the subsequent period leader Kim Jong Il saw to it that it was reconstructed as the Songdowon International Children's Camp and visited it in March, 1993 when the country was in a grave situation.
					
					He said it is the firm determination of the WPK to successfully remodel the camp closely associated with the leadership exploits of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as required by the new century.
					
					He proposed erecting statues of the Generalissimos among children while undertaking the project in order to convey their noble love for future and posterity down through generations.
					
					He specified instructions for remodeling the camp, going round the camp building, the International Friendship Children's Hall and other places of the camp visited by Kim Jong Il on March 30, 1993.
					
					He looked round some bedrooms including Room 221 visited by Kim Jong Il and told officials to provide them with better furniture and TV sets.
					
					He underscored the need to decorate walls of rooms with wallpapers beautiful in color and pattern to suit children's minds and take thorough measures for heating and electricity so that they may not feel any inconvenience in their camping.
					
					Looking round the lobby of the camp building, he said that it is 20 years old but it still looks impeccable in architectural beauty as Kim Jong Il led the designing and construction of the camp with loving care.
					
					Going round the International Friendship Children's Hall, he stressed the need to set up a guide board written in foreign languages so that it may be convenient to children from various countries of the world.
					
					At the room for disseminating knowledge about seas, he gave an instruction to provide it with varieties of specimen so that campers may acquire not only knowledge about seas but that about animals and plants.
					
					He said that the camp should be operated in winter, too, in the future so that children may enjoy skiing at the Masik Pass Skiing Ground now under construction.
					
					Calling at the wading pool and boating site, he said he would send modern wading equipment and told officials to spruce them up as well as they please.
					
					Going round the playground, he called for building a running track and covering the football field with artificial turf and providing new facilities for sports events such as volleyball and basketball.
					
					He proposed displaying slogans "We Are the Happiest in the World!" and "General Goes to Front While Children Go to Camp!" which convey the loving care of the Generalissimos for posterity.
					
					Visiting the beach, he underscored the need to build dressing rooms and diving towers, provide modern shower equipment and take necessary measures for preventing sand from piling up there.
					
					He took measures for building a new ground for education at the camp and paving its sidewalks again, adding that he would send vehicles needed for its management and operation.
					
					He was accompanied by Choe Hwi, first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun, vice department directors of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Songdowon Youth Open-air Theatre
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Songdowon Youth Open-air Theatre
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to the Songdowon Youth Open-air Theatre.
					He looked round the room dedicated to the history of the theatre.
					
					He recalled the words of leader Kim Jong Il that he would watch a performance of the State Merited Chorus with citizens of Wonsan City there if the seating capacity of the theatre would be increased to 5 000, adding that he could not keep the promise.
					
					Noting that the theatre is closely associated with the profound loving care of the great Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the people, he underscored the need to manage the theatre better and put its operation on a regular basis so as to eternally glorify their exploits.
					
					As the room dedicated to the history of the theatre is the place for educating visitors, it should be arranged and furnished well so that many working people, youth and students may visit it, he said.
					
					He went round various places of the theatre.
					
					Being seated without reserve on the chair used by audience, he examined its height and told officials to readjust the chairs in such a way as to make them convenient to the audience.
					
					Watching the stage roof of ball truss style, he said that the stage was roofless in the past but it was newly built well as instructed by Kim Jong Il. The stage looks nice after its remodeling, he added.
					
					After learning about how the open-air theatre is used, he underlined the need to ensure that songs and dances and exciting agitation are always presented there. He said he would spare time to watch an art performance at the theatre together with Wonsan citizens.
					
					He instructed the Kangwon Provincial Committee of the WPK and working people's organizations in the province including the provincial committee of the youth league to pay deep attention to the management and operation of the open-air theatre so that it may creditably discharge its mission.
					
					Calling for successfully remodeling the open-air theatre as a fashionable one which will well match its environment and remain impeccable in the distant future, he indicated the tasks and ways to do so.
					
					He had a photo session with the employees of the open-air theatre.
					
					He was accompanied by Choe Hwi, first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Pak Thae Song and Ma Won Chun, vice department directors of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Delegation of DWUK Back Home
articles.content:
Delegation of DWUK Back Home
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) led by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of its Central Committee, flew back on Thursday after visiting Mexico.

articles.title: Press Conference Held with Successful Table-Tennis Players
articles.content:
Press Conference Held with Successful Table-Tennis Players
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A press conference took place at Kim Il Sung Stadium on Thursday with DPRK table-tennis players Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong who won gold medals in mixed doubles of the 52nd ITTF World Championships (individual events).
					At the press conference they said they could achieve such success startling the world table tennis circle as they applied the Korean-style principle and methods to every game with the patriotic desire to make a report of victory to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					They recalled Kim Jong Un has bestowed great honor upon the sportspersons who raised the flag of the DPRK in international games. 
					
					Noting that they were deeply touched by the warm welcome they received from Pyongyangites upon their return home, they stressed that the world knows no such blessed people as the Korean sportspersons. 
					
					They pledged to undergo more intensive trainings to win more gold medals and thus demonstrate before the world the spirit of the great Paektusan nation.

articles.title: Pyongyangites Warmly Welcome World Table Tennis Gold Medalists
articles.content:
Pyongyangites Warmly Welcome World Table Tennis Gold Medalists
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK paddlers Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong returned home on Thursday after bagging gold medals in mixed doubles of the 52nd ITTF World Championships (individual events) held in Paris.
					When a plane landed, people and sportspersons in Pyongyang warmly welcomed the gold medalists.
					
					They were greeted by Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Ri Yong Su, department director of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Jong Mu, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, Jon Yong Nam, chairman of the C.C., the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, and other officials concerned.
					
					The players paid floral tribute to the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					Sportspersons congratulated the players on their success in the matches, presenting garlands and bouquets to them.
					
					Acknowledging the cheers of the crowd, the players headed for the city by car.
					
					Pyongyangites warmly congratulated the players along the routes from the entrance of Ryonmot-dong to Ryonghung crossroads and Kaesonmun, Changjon and other streets.
					
					Kim Hyok Bong and Kim Jong, overcome with deep thanks to the dear respected Marshal Kim Jong Un, pledged to raise the DPRK flag in more international games.
					
					They laid bouquets before the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill and paid tribute to them before making a report of victory and glory to them.

articles.title: DPRK Marks World No-Tobacco Day
articles.content:
DPRK Marks World No-Tobacco Day
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- An event was held at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Club on Thursday to mark the World No-Tobacco Day.
					Present there were officials in the field of public health, ministries and national institutions, staff members of missions of international bodies here including the acting representative of the World Health Organization (WHO).
					
					Speakers there said that they would solve issues arising in no-smoking activities in close touch with international bodies including the WHO and steadily expand the successes made in that work.
					
					The participants watched a video on no-smoking before enjoying an art performance given by schoolchildren.
					
					Then they toured the No-smoking Research Centre.

articles.title: Mongolian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
articles.content:
Mongolian Embassy Officials Help Korean Farmers
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Mongolian Ambassador Manibadrakh Ganbold and staff members of his embassy here did friendship labor at the DPRK-Mongolia Friendship Jongbang Co-op Farm in Sariwon City, North Hwanghae Province on Thursday.
					They helped farmers in weeding a corn field.
					
					The ambassador said he would make efforts to boost the bilateral friendly relations, wishing the farm bigger success in its work.

articles.title: Sports Park and Football School Completed
articles.content:
Sports Park and Football School Completed
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Rungna People's Sports Park and Pyongyang International Football School appeared on the picturesque Rungna Islet here. 
					The sports park is a comprehensive sports service center covering more than 200 000 square meters. It has a football field, basketball and volleyball courts, skate park and various other sporting facilities. There are small parks, a restaurant and soft-drink stands. 
					
					The football school, a center for training future footballers, has a school-building, hostel and cultural and welfare establishments.
					
					A ceremony for their completion took place on Thursday. 
					
					Present at the ceremony were Pak Pong Ju, Choe Thae Bok, Mun Kyong Dok and others. 
					
					Pak Pong Ju, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and premier of the DPRK Cabinet, in his address said that they are the edifices of eternal value which have sprung up thanks to the noble intention of the dear respected Kim Jong Un to usher in a new era of high civilization in the 21st century and his energetic leadership.
					
					He called upon the officials and employees of the park and teachers of the school to thoroughly implement the important tasks given by Kim Jong Un to make a positive contribution to materializing the WPK idea of turning the country into a sports power.
					
					He underscored the need to minutely organize sports service to visitors and successfully operate the park so that people may benefit from the deep loving care of the party.
					
					He stressed the need for the sports school to steadily improve the contents and methods of education as required by the developing reality and successfully manage and operate it so as to train more promising footballers.
					
					After being briefed on the park and school, the participants looked round them.

articles.title: Poem-reciting and Singing Event of Schoolchildren Held
articles.content:
Poem-reciting and Singing Event of Schoolchildren Held
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A poem-reciting and singing event "Song of Best Wishes" was held by schoolchildren at the Central Youth Hall on Thursday to mark the 60th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's creation of immortal classic "Song of Best Wishes".
					The song is a hymn of loyalty created by Kim Jong Il on June 1, Juche 42 (1953), in reflection of the ardent wishes of the service personnel and people of the DPRK for the safety of President Kim Il Sung on inspection of the far-off front.
					
					Put on the stage were such numbers as chorus "Song of Best Wishes" and prologue "The song of wishes reverberates through the country".
					
					The performers showed that the above-said song is always heard from among the people as a hymn to the sun.
					
					Dialogic poem "The road to the front carrying the best wishes of the people", serial songs "Our father" and "Love shown by General" and other numbers truthfully represented the boundless reverence of the schoolchildren throughout the country for Kim Jong Il.
					
					Boys chorus "Marshal Kim Jong Un is the best" and narrative poem "The country blessed by the sun" and other numbers represented the happy schoolchildren in the era of Songun Korea growing under the loving care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Archery, Promising Event for DPRK
articles.content:
Archery, Promising Event for DPRK
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The 50th National Games of Juvenile Sports Schools are now going on in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, with archery as one of the events.
					In this regard, KCNA had an interview with O Kwang Sun, deputy secretary of the DPRK Archery Association.
					
					Question: I know that archery has been regarded for the DPRK as a promising event at international tournaments. Can you tell me about the country's archery development?
					
					Answer: Archery skills have improved remarkably under the care of the government.
					
					Scores of archers selected from juvenile sports schools show good results in the ongoing games.
					
					New national records have been set in the archery event in recent years. The April 25 Defense Sports Team made six new records in the 2011 National Championships and two new records were witnessed at the 12th People's Games (professional group) held in 2012.
					
					Videos on archery skills have been applied to training.
					
					We are paying big efforts to the improvement of archers' skills with an aim of making good results at the 31st Olympiad.
					
					Q: What kinds of categories are there in the archery event?
					
					A: Archery was listed as one of the Olympic events at the 20th Olympic Games and became varied in category with its repaid development on a worldwide scale. 
					
					Its categories include outdoor and indoor archery and distance archery. Outdoor archery is encouraged in the country.
					
					Q: Would you tell me about the DPRK Archery Association?
					
					A: Formed in March Juche 42 (1953), the Association joined the International Archery Federation in July 1961.
					
					The DPRK proved successful at the 28th World Archery Championships and the 8th and 9th Asian Games.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Denying June 15 Joint Declaration: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Slammed for Denying June 15 Joint Declaration: KCNA Commentary
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Recently the DPRK proposed south Korea holding joint events to mark the anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration, the first ones since the emergence of the new "government" in south Korea.
					The proposal for jointly holding the pro-reunification events to be participated in by compatriots from the north, south and overseas has won strong support and response from Koreans as it would mark an important occasion in ending the five year-old stalemate in the inter-Korean dialogue.
					
					However, the south Korean authorities refused the proposal, citing lame excuses after delaying their reply to it for several days.
					
					In a statement of the spokesman for the "Ministry of Unification" and at a press conference they unhesitatingly talked rubbish that "the north's proposal is doubtful in its sincerity", "it aims at fomenting disputes among southerners" and "it seeks politically-motivated intention". 
					
					Following in their footsteps, the ultra-right confrontation elements have termed the proposal "a double-dealing offensive for dialogue" and "a preposterous one", saying the inter-governmental dialogue should precede a non-governmental event.
					
					This is nothing but a brazen-faced challenge to the internal and external public opinion calling for putting an end to the worst confrontation between compatriots, defusing tension and improving inter-Korean relations. It is also a blatant provocation against the DPRK which sets store by the great cause of the nation.
					
					The nearer the historic anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration comes, the more ardently Koreans are longing for the precious era when a broad way of inter-Korean dialogue and cooperation was paved over a barrier of distrust and confrontation which had lasted for more than half a century.
					
					Moreover, on-going confrontation is too painful for Koreans to bear as they bitterly experienced the difference between the June 15 era and the one of confrontation during the period of Lee Myung Bak's rule when the inter-Korean relations plunged into a catastrophe.
					
					In the strict sense of words, the proposal of the DPRK is a product of its broad magnanimity to attach importance to the nation's concord and iron out the discord between compatriots at any cost.
					
					The sophism of the south Korean regime and its disallowance of the joint events can not be construed otherwise than its attempt to go back to the days before the June 15 era, the days of the Lee Myung Bak's regime ill-famed for escalated confrontation, when the nation had to suffer turns and twists to sign a single agreement and achieve a single round of exchange and cooperation.
					
					It is not fortuitous that the religious organizations and progressive media in south Korea commented that "the proposal might be a good occasion for ending the inter-Korean showdown and opening up a phase of dialogue" and "the north's suggestion of selecting Kaesong or Mt. Kumgang resort as a venue of the events has a great significance as it means providing a momentum of reconciliation and cooperation through the normalization of operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone and the resumption of tour of Mt. Kumgang."
					
					If the events are held as a process of linking kinship between compatriots, the issues including the one of normalizing the operation in the Kaesong Industrial Zone will be settled.
					
					The proposal of the DPRK is to save the joint declaration. Refusal to it is, therefore, tantamount to negating the declaration.
					
					The south Korean regime would be well advised to face up to the reality.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Ensure June 15 Joint National Events
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Ensure June 15 Joint National Events
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Kwangju-South Jolla Provincial Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration held a press conference outside the Kwangju City Office on Tuesday demanding the puppet authorities ensure the June 15 joint national events.
					In a press release the organization accused the Ministry of Unification of turning down the proposal made by the North Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration to hold the events to mark the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration to be attended by representatives of the south, the north and overseas sides.
					
					The tension on the Korean Peninsula has reached an extreme phase and the Kaesong Industrial Zone was put in the danger of closure due to the U.S.-south Korea Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military exercises staged from last March, the press release noted, and continued:
					
					In order to put an end to the state of war on the peninsula which has lasted for six decades, it is necessary to replace the Armistice Agreement with a peace treaty and opt for implementing the June 15 joint declaration, a landmark for reunification.
					
					The June 15 joint national events can help mend the strained south-north relations as they will reaffirm the will to implement the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					The present regime should positively ensure the events, bearing in mind that it is only the Korean nation which will suffer from its persistent policy of confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Urged to Accept North's Proposal for Event Common to Nation
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Urged to Accept North's Proposal for Event Common to Nation
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration organized a press conference on May 28 in denunciation of the puppet authorities for their unreasonable act of disallowing the event common to the nation, according to Yonhap News of south Korea.
					At the conference speakers recalled that the south Korean authorities, citing the issue of the Kaesong Industrial Zone, rejected the proposal of the North Side Committee for holding an event common to the nation in which Koreans from the north, south and overseas are represented on the occasion of the 13th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					
					They said the authorities threw away an important opportunity in mending the south-north ties.
					
					Saying they would make strenuous efforts for the opening of the event, they urged the authorities to accept the north's proposal.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Their Moves to Stamp Out Pro-reunification Forces
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Their Moves to Stamp Out Pro-reunification Forces
						
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Seoul High Court of south Korea recently sentenced Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification, to four years in prison for the mere reason that he visited Pyongyang to express condolences over the demise of leader Kim Jong Il. The court also passed a prison term on its Secretary General Won Jin Uk for helping Ro visit Pyongyang though Won is seriously ill.
					Minju Joson Thursday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This was an outrageous fascist action to chill the daily growing desire of the people for reunification and stamp out the pro-reunification movement forces in south Korea.
					
					Both Ro and Won can by no means be targets of suppression, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					The puppet forces are working with blood-shot eyes to eliminate pro-reunification movement organizations by labeling them "criminal organizations" and "organizations benefiting the enemy." The fascist suppression is a product of such scenario.
					
					What is more intolerable is that they took such repressive actions against the pro-reunification patriots in the run-up to the 13th anniversary of the historic June 15 joint declaration.
					
					The south Korean ruling forces are following in the footsteps of the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors, hordes of wicked anti-reunification elements.
					
					They had better draw a proper lesson from the miserable end of the Lee Myung Bak regime and roll back at once their confrontation policy which pushed the inter-Korean relations to catastrophe and set free Ro Su Hui and other pro-reunification patriots.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Revive "Yusin" Dictatorship Denounced
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities' Moves to Revive "Yusin" Dictatorship Denounced
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean authorities recently disallowed the singing of the song "March for the Love" which has been traditionally sung in the memorial event of the Kwangju Popular Uprising. Meanwhile, they let ultra-right conservative media release misinformation that the Kwangju Popular Uprising broke out "with a special unit of the north involved".
					Rodong Sinmun Thursday says in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					This is a revelation of the attempt to revive the fascist dictatorship as it is aimed to defame the tradition of the sanguinary struggle of the people for democracy and bring its precious achievements to naught.
					
					These actions of the present puppet authorities of south Korea indicate that the conservative forces' bid to turn south Korean society entirely conservative and fascist has reached its height, the commentary notes, and goes on: 
					
					Their attempt to ban the above-said song which even their predecessors dared not do reminds the people of the revived "yusin constitution". 
					
					It is the sinister scenario of the present puppet ruling quarters of south Korea to dampen the spirit of the progressive forces by labeling the Kwangju Popular Uprising as a riot staged by the "group following the north," arrest their actions and reinforce the conservative base by fascist suppression in an effort to create conditions favorable for their long-term office. 
					
					It was to serve the above-said purpose that the group decried the uprising as a "riot of mobs backed by a special unit of the north." 
					
					The desperate efforts of the conservative group to defame the history of the just struggle of the people for independence, democracy and reunification and escalate the moves to revive the "yusin" dictatorship are as foolish acts as tightening the noose around its own neck.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Unpopular Education Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Unpopular Education Policy
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Federation of University Students in the 21st Century held a press conference in Seoul on Monday to denounce the puppet authorities for their unpopular education policy, according to the south Korean CBS.
					At the conference speakers said that only students will suffer from the authorities' unilateral enforcement of university restructuring.
					
					They demanded an interview with the minister of Education.

articles.title: Two Japanese Drug Traffickers Prosecuted in S. Korea
articles.content:
Two Japanese Drug Traffickers Prosecuted in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A joint investigation team under the south Korean puppet Inchon District Prosecutor's Office and the Inchon Headquarters Customs prosecuted two Japanese drug traffickers who attempted to run away to Japan on Tuesday, according to the south Korean paper Kukmin Ilbo.
					The accused were reported to have been possessed of Philopon the amount of which was enough to administer to more than 208,000 persons at the same time.

articles.title: U.S.-looted Cultural Property Dating back to Feudal Joson Dynasty Discovered
articles.content:
U.S.-looted Cultural Property Dating back to Feudal Joson Dynasty Discovered
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A royal seal dating back to the Feudal Joson Dynasty was discovered in the U.S. recently, according to south Korean KBS on Tuesday. It was looted by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces during the Korean War.
					It was reported that this royal seal made in 1651 had been preserved in Jongro, Seoul.
					
					This was available from an art collector in Los Angeles, the U.S.
					
					The Korean nation will surely force the U.S. to pay for the precious cultural treasures associated with its history spanning 5 000 years savagely vandalized or looted by its aggressor forces during the war.

articles.title: British Organizations Observe Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
articles.content:
British Organizations Observe Anniversary of Kwangju Popular Uprising
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Branch of the Korean Friendship Association in a joint statement issued on May 22 said the blood shed by the participants in the Kwangju Popular Uprising of south Korea would never be in vain.  
					It is 33 years since the citizens of Kwangju in south Korea rose in an uprising against the fascist junta's corrupt and unpopular policy and the U.S. imperialists' colonial domination, the statement noted, and continued:
					
					The uprising was a courageous and heroic struggle waged by people and revolutionaries in south Korea against imperialism and fascism and recorded a new chapter in the history of the south Korean people's struggle for independence, democracy and reunification.
					
					Admirable, indeed, were heroism, prowess and self-sacrificing spirit displayed by the resistance fighters.
					
					The uprising greatly encouraged the world progressive people in their struggle against dictatorship.
					
					The uprisers courageously fought against the tyranny of the south Korean puppet troops patronized by the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces.
					
					The uprising taught the truth that independence and social changes can never be achieved by a peaceful means but counter-revolutionary violence should be countered by revolutionary violence without fail.
					
					We pay tribute to the heroic spirit of the participants in the uprising on its 33rd anniversary.
					
					We extend firm support to the south Korean people in their struggle to bring down the puppet regime, drive out the Yankee imperialists out of south Korea and achieve independence, democracy and reunification.

articles.title: DPRK's Firm Stand against U.S. Nuclear Blackmail Hailed in Brazil
articles.content:
DPRK's Firm Stand against U.S. Nuclear Blackmail Hailed in Brazil
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Committee for Solidarity with the DPRK posted a commentary titled "Nuclear Weapons Are Not Monopoly of U.S." on its website on May 24.
					Noting that the world was exposed to a nuclear threat again after the demise of the Cold War, the commentary disclosed the fact that the U.S. ignited wars of aggression in different parts of the world after openly listing those countries it considered as hurdles in carrying out its strategy for dominating the world as "targets of "preemptive nuclear strike".
					
					Underscoring the urgency to hold in check the specified state's nuclear monopoly as required by the new era, the commentary went on:
					
					At present there is a country standing firm against the U.S. nuclear monopoly and blackmail as required by our times.
					
					That is the DPRK, neither a nuclear weapons state nor a big country by origin but a small country in the East. 
					
					The DPRK has emerged a full-fledged nuclear weapons state and a satellite launcher which no one dares attack. 
					
					Having this tremendous might, the DPRK is offering do-or-die resistance for the defence of its sovereignty.
					
					There has unfolded such an unbelievable reality in which the U.S. is left with no option but to advocate "a strategy for the defense of its mainland" from a nuclear attack though it used to threaten other countries with nukes.
					
					Gone are the days never to return when the U.S. could browbeat the DPRK with nukes.
					
					Nukes are no longer a monopoly of the U.S.

articles.title: Japanese Ultra-rightist's Reckless Remarks Blasted
articles.content:
Japanese Ultra-rightist's Reckless Remarks Blasted
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- At least 60 international human rights organizations, including Amnesty International, the Asian Human Rights Committee and the human rights organization of Japan, jointly denounced an ultra-rightist of Japan, according to south Korean CBS on Tuesday.
					Accusing Osaka Mayor Hashimoto of his recent remarks justifying the crimes related to sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, the organizations termed them reckless outbursts.
					
					Running high worldwide are voices blasting the Japanese ultra-right conservative forces for justifying such monstrous crimes committed in the past after forcing 200 000 Korean women into sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army.

articles.title: Campeones mundiales de ping-pong se entrevistan con medios de prensa
articles.content:
Campeones mundiales de ping-pong se entrevistan con medios de prensa
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Kim Hyok Bong y Kim Jong, quienes conquistaron medalla de oro en el doble mixto del 52o Campeonato Mundial de Ping-Pong de la Federacion Internacional de Ping-Pong, concedieron este jueves en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung una rueda de prensa con los reporteros de esta capital. 
					Kim Hyok Bong y Kim Jong dijeron que pudieron lograr esta vez el resultado sorprendente al circulo mundial de tenis de mesa porque aplicaron en cada partido el principio y los metodos de juego al estilo coreano con el deseo patriotico de dar el parte de victoria al Mariscal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					Mencionaron que el Mariscal concede gran honor a los deportistas que triunfan en las competencias internacionales. 
					
					Muy conmovidos de la calurosa bienvenida de los capitalinos, apuntaron que en este mundo no hay otros deportistas tan felices como los coreanos. 
					
					Manifestaron la decision de derramar mucho mas sudor en los entrenamientos y contribuir a exaltar con las medallas de oro la imagen de la potencia del monte Paektu.

articles.title: Tiro al arco tiene buenas perspectivas: entrevista con O Kwang Sun
articles.content:
Tiro al arco tiene buenas perspectivas: entrevista con O Kwang Sun
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Esta en plena marcha en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea la 50a competencia deportiva nacional de las escuelas deportivas de jovenes y ninos.
					En conversacion con la ACNC sostenida al pie de la cancha de tiro al arco, O Kwang Sun, subsecretaria general de la Asociacion de Tiro al Arco de la RPDC, expreso optimismo por las perspectivas de esa disciplina.
					
					Reportero: Haga el favor de decirme sobre la presente competencia, la situacion actual del tiro al arco de nuestro pais y los eventos internacionales en que van a participar nuestros jugadores.
					
					O Kwang Sun: Actualmente, el nivel tecnico de nuestros arqueros sube cada dia mas bajo la atencion estatal. Lo comprueba esta competencia.
					
					Bajo la atencion especial de los entrenadores, decenas de jugadores, seleccionados de las escuelas deportivas de jovenes y ninos de todo el pais, registran altos puntos.
					
					En los ultimos anos, se establecieron recordes nacionales en el tiro al arco.
					
					En el Campeonato Nacional, que tuvo lugar en 2011, los jugadores del Conjunto de Deportes Militares 25 de Abril lograron establecer 6 recordes nacionales.
					
					Se registraron dos recordes nacionales en la categoria de conjuntos deportivos de la XII Competencia Deportiva del Pueblo del ano pasado.
					
					Los organos de investigacion cientifica y los entrenadores estan trabajando para hacer un video sobre las tecnicas basicas, el tiro certero y los movimientos detallados y para aplicarlo en el entrenamiento.
					
					Los sectores correspondientes se concentran en el desarrollo tecnico de los arqueros y trazaron la meta inmediata de lograr buenos resultados en el tiro al arco de los 31o Juegos Olimpicos.
					
					Reportero: ?Cuales son las modalidades detalladas del tiro al arco?
					
					O Kwang Sun: El tiro al arco devino deporte oficial desde 20o Juegos Olimpicos. Desde entonces, se divulga rapido en escala mundial y se incrementan sus disciplinas detalladas. 
					
					Entre ellas hay el tiro al aire libre, el bajo techo y el de larga distancia, etc. Nuestro pais fomenta la primera modalidad.
					
					Reportero: ?Y cuando fue fundada la asociacion de ustedes?
					
					O Kwang Sun: La Asociacion del Tiro al Arco de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea quedo organizada en marzo del 1953 y se afilio en julio del 1961 a la Federacion Internacional del Tiro al Arco. Nuestros arqueros sobresalieron en varias citas deportivas, incluyendo el 28o Campeonato Mundial del Tiro al Arco y los 8o y 9o Juegos Asiaticos.

articles.title: Tiene lugar el acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de No Fumar
articles.content:
Tiene lugar el acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de No Fumar
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este jueves en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang el acto dedicado al Dia Mundial de No Fumar.
					En la ocasion participaron los funcionarios de Salud Publica, ministerios y organos centrales, el representante interino de la OMS y otros miembros de otras organizaciones internacionales en Corea. 
					
					Los oradores apuntaron que resolveran los problemas que se presenten en las actividades de no fumar en estrecha colaboracion con la OMS y otras organizaciones internacionales y ampliar de continuo los exitos alcanzados. 
					
					Los participantes vieron una videocinta y una funcion artistica de ninos escolares. 
					
					Luego, visitaron el Centro de Estudio y Divulgacion de No Fumar.

articles.title: ACNC comenta negativa surcoreana a la propuesta de la RPDC
articles.content:
ACNC comenta negativa surcoreana a la propuesta de la RPDC
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Recientemente, la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea propuso a la parte surcoreana celebrar en conjunto el 13o aniversario de publicacion de la Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio, que se acoge por primera vez despues del cambio del "poder" en el Sur de Corea.
					Esta propuesta, que preve tambien la presencia de compatriotas residentes en ultramar, es apoyada fuertemente por toda la nacion porque persigue hacer esa efemeride de una oportunidad importante para reabrir el dialogo N-S, estancado en los ultimos 5 anos.
					
					Pero, las autoridades surcoreanas la negaron con pretextos absurdos luego de varios dias sin respuesta.
					
					Para colmo, a traves de la declaracion del vocero del "Ministerio de Unificacion" y rueda de prensa, dijeron que "es dudosa la sinceridad del Norte (de Corea)", la "propuesta persigue fomentar las discordias entre las personas" e "implica fines politicos".
					
					Siguiendo el ejemplo de las autoridades, los elementos conflictivos y ultraderechistas insisten en anteponer el dialogo entre autoridades al acto de nivel civil y se atreven a difamar esa iniciativa como "ofensiva de dialogo de doble rasero" y "absurdidad".
					
					Tal conducta resulta un desafio cinico contra la opinion publica interna y externa, que desea poner punto final a la confrontacion fratricida de la peor fase de la historia y mejorar las relaciones N-S, y una grave provocacion contra la RPDC que aprecia gran proposito de la nacion.
					
					Cada vez que se acerca el dia conmemorativo de publicacion de la declaracion intercoreana, todos los coreanos anoran la valiosa epoca del 15 de Junio en que fue levantada la barrera de desconfianza y confrontacion mantenida durante mas de medio siglo y se abrio plenamente el camino de dialogo y cooperacion entre ambas partes coreanas.
					
					Ademas, el actual estado de enfrentamiento duele mas a todos los coreanos que acaban de experimentar las diferencias entre la epoca del 15 de Junio y la del enfrentamiento en el mandato de Lee Myung Bak en que las relaciones intercoreanas se tornaron catastroficas.
					
					Si necesitaran las formalidades especiales para relajar el peor estado de confrontacion de los 5 anos pasados y los enfrentamientos verbales entre ambas partes, la gran empresa de la nacion coreana se volveria estancada hoy dia tambien.
					
					En ese sentido, la reciente propuesta de la RPDC es producto de su magnanimidad orientada a dar importancia a la reconciliacion de la nacion y superar a toda costa la discordia entre los compatriotas.
					
					Los disparates de las autoridades surcoreanas y su desautorizacion del acto conjunto N-S se interpretan como que ellas tratan de volver al periodo anterior al 15 de Junio y al "regimen" de Lee Myung Bak cuando costaba tremendo trabajo para lograr un solo acuerdo y realizar un solo proyecto de intercambio y cooperacion entre el Norte y el Sur de Corea.
					
					Por otra parte, las entidades religiosas y los medios de prensa progresistas del Sur de Corea subrayaron que "la resiente propuesta (de la RPDC) sera una buena oportunidad para lograr la paz dando punto final a la tensa coyuntura de confrontacion intercoreana" y la "proposicion de Kaesong y el monte Kumgang como sedes del acto tiene mucho sentido para preparar la oportunidad de reconciliacion y cooperacion a traves de la normalizacion de la Zona Industrial de Kaesong y el reinicio del turismo al monte Kumgang".
					
					En el proceso de union de los sentimientos fraternales por medio de actos conjuntos y otros encuentros N-S se resolveran los problemas, inclusive la normalizacion de operacion de la ZIK, que cuestionan tantos las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					La propuesta de la RPDC es para salvar la Declaracion Conjunta N-S y la negativa a ella significa el rechazo a la misma nota.
					
					Las autoridades surcoreanas deben ver correctamente la corriente de la epoca.

articles.title: Minju Joson denuncia represion de autoridades surcoreanas contra fuerzas pro-reunificacion
articles.content:
Minju Joson denuncia represion de autoridades surcoreanas contra fuerzas pro-reunificacion
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el Tribunal Supremo de Seul de Sur de Corea condeno a 4 anos de prision al vicepresidente de la Direccion Surena de la Alianza Pannacional por la Reunificacion de la Patria, Ro Su Hui, quien habia visitado a Pyongyang para expresar condolencias por el gran duelo de la nacion coreana (fallecimiento del Dirigente Kim Jong Il). 
					Impuso penas hasta al secretario general de la misma organizacion, Won Jin Uk, quien padece ahora una grave enfermedad, por el absurdo cargo de haber ayudado la visita a Pyongyang de Ro.
					
					En un comentario individual divulgado este jueves, el rotativo Minju Joson condeno las sentencias calificandolas de acto fascista para sofocar la creciente aspiracion de los habitantes a la reunificacion y exterminar las fuerzas del movimiento por la reunificacion.
					
					El vicepresidente Ro y el secretario general Won no pueden ser en ningun caso blancos de represion.
					
					Las autoridades titeres surcoreanas estan desesperadas para acabar con las entidades del movimiento por la reunificacion estigmatizandolas como "criminales" y "pro-enemigas". 
					
					Lo que causa mas indignacion es el hecho de que esos patriotas luchadores por la reunificacion fueron sentenciados en visperas del 13o aniversario de publicacion de la historica Declaracion Conjunta Norte-Sur del 15 de Junio.
					
					Las actuales fuerzas en el poder del Sur de Corea repiten el antecedente de la horda traidora de Lee Myung Bak opuesta a la reunificacion.
					
					Ellas deben aprender la leccion del fin tragico del traidor Lee, cancelar de inmediato la politica conflictiva que lleva las relaciones entre ambas partes coreanas a la fase catastrofica, y poner en libertad al vicepresidente Ro Su Hui y otras personalidades patrioticas pro-reunificacion.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun revela campana de resurgimiento de dictadura Yusin en Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun revela campana de resurgimiento de dictadura Yusin en Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Recientemente, las autoridades surcoreanas intentaron  prohibir la interpretacion de la cancion "Marcha por el amante" cantada tradicionalmente en el acto conmemorativo del Levantamiento Popular de Kwangju, mientras por medio de medios de prensa conservadores y ultraderechistas, lo tergiversaron como si hubiera ocurrido por la "intervencion del destacamento especial del Norte (de Corea)".
					Esto es la manifestacion del intento de las fuerzas conservadoras de resucitar la dictadura fascista para exterminar la tradicion de la lucha sangrienta por la democracia y las nobles conquistas de los habitantes.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este jueves y continua:
					
					Esta campana insinua que esta en el apogeo el complot de las fuerzas conservadoras para fascistizar la sociedad surcoreana.
					
					La intencion de la actual banda titere de prohibir cantarla da la sensacion de que renaciera la "constitucion Yusin (renovacion)".
					
					Las fuerzas en el poder actual se desesperan por doblegar el animo y exterminar la lucha de las fuerzas progresistas calificando el levantamiento popular de Kwangju como sublevacion del "grupo pro-Norte" y preparar una condicion favorable al mandato a largo plazo fortaleciendo la base conservadora con la  represion fascista.
					
					Partiendo de tal proposito, la banda titere insulto lanzando los medios de prensa conservadores y ultraderechistas, el levantamiento popular de Kwangju como "rebelion de los insurgentes con la  intervencion del destacamento especial del Norte".
					
					La banda titere mancha la historia de la justa lucha de los habitantes surcoreanos por la independencia, la democracia y la reunificacion y actua con frenesi para resucitar la dictadura Yusin, lo cual es la locura absurda que adelanta su autodestruccion.
